properties.areaDesc: Point Isabelle to Lower Entrance of Portage Canal MI; Huron Islands to Marquette MI; Manitou Island to Point Isabelle MI; Lake Superior East of a line from Manitou Island to Marquette MI and West of a line from Grand Marais MI to the US/Canadian Border Beyond 5NM from shore; Eagle River to Manitou Island MI; Marquette to Munising MI; Lake Superior from Saxon Harbor WI to Upper Entrance to Portage Canal MI 5NM off shore to the US/Canadian border including Isle Royal National Park; Ontonagon to Upper Entrance of Portage Canal MI; Munising to Grand Marais MI; Lake Superior West of Line from Manitou Island to Marquette MI Beyond 5NM from shore; Black River To Ontonagon MI; Lake Superior from Upper Entrance to Portage Canal to Manitou Island MI 5NM off shore to the US/Canadian Border; Saxon Harbor WI to Black River MI; Portage Lake to Huron Island MI to Lower Entrance of Portage Canal To Huron Islands MI Including Keweenaw and Huron Bays; Upper Entrance of Portage Canal to Eagle River MI
properties.headline: Heavy Freezing Spray Warning issued February 7 at 10:39AM EST until February 7 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Marquette MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy freezing spray at a rate of 2 cm per hour or
greater occurring, and may rapidly accumulate on vessels.

* WHERE...Portions of Central, Eastern and Western Lake Superior.

* WHEN...Until 9 PM EST /8 PM CST/ this evening.

* IMPACTS...Operating a vessel in heavy freezing spray is
hazardous. Freezing spray may render mechanical and electronic
components inoperative. Rapid ice accretion on decks and
superstructures may result in a catastrophic loss of stability.
properties.instruction:
Mariners should prepare for dangerous accumulation of ice on
their vessel. If possible, remain in port, avoid the warning area
or conduct mitigation.

NWSheadline: HEAVY FREEZING SPRAY WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST /8 PM CST/ THIS EVENING
